TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant initiated civil proceedings against the local administration seeking formal acknowledgment of his entitlement to child benefits and the relevant arrears .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) dismissed his claims finding that he was not eligible for the sought benefits . The applicant appealed against the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG summoned the applicant to appear at the appeal hearing fixed for DATE . There is no evidence that the summons was dispatched or that the applicant indeed received it .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined and dismissed as unfounded the applicant ’s appeal . The applicant was absent from the appeal hearing , and the appeal court did not examine the question of his due notification at the hearing .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , on DATE he inquired about the date of the appeal hearing at the registry of ORG and was told that ORG had already examined and dismissed his appeal .
